question_text: A delivery truck is transporting two types of boxes: small boxes weighing $30$ pounds each and large boxes weighing $50$ pounds each.  For each delivery, the truck must carry at least $12$ boxes, and the total weight of the boxes cannot exceed $600$ pounds. What is the maximum number of large boxes that the truck can carry per delivery?
Which of the following ordered pairs $(x, y)$ satisfies the system of inequalities below? $$y > -2x + 3$$ $$x + y \leq 4$$

A small business currently spends $\$1,500$ per year on traditional light bulbs. The owner is considering switching to LED bulbs, which would cost $\$4,800$ to install but are estimated to reduce the annual lighting cost to $\$900$.  Which of the following inequalities can be solved to find $t$, the number of years after installation at which the total amount of electricity cost savings will exceed the installation cost?

A coffee shop estimates that on a typical weekday, they sell between $350$ and $400$ cups of coffee before noon. Based on this estimate, which inequality represents the possible total revenue, in dollars, from coffee sales before noon on a weekday if each cup of coffee costs $\$3$?

A shipping company uses cylindrical containers to transport goods. The standard diameter of a container must be at least $4$ feet and no more than $5$ feet. A cargo ship has a storage bay that is $60$ feet wide. The containers are to be placed side-by-side along the width of the storage bay. Let $n$ be the number of containers that can be placed in a row across the width of the storage bay. Which of the following describes all the possible values of $n$?
Which of the following ordered pairs $(x, y)$ is a solution to the system of inequalities below? $$y \geq x + 1$$ $$y \leq -x - 1$$

The formula to convert Celsius ($C$) to Fahrenheit ($F$) is $F = \frac{9}{5}C + 32$. The Fahrenheit temperature in a refrigerator must be at most $41$ degrees Fahrenheit. Which inequality represents the condition for the Celsius temperature? Let $C$ be the Celsius temperature.

A certain plant is $5$ inches tall when planted and grows more than $0.5$ inch but less than $0.75$ inch per week. Which of the following inequalities represents all possible heights $h$, in inches, for the plant $52$ weeks after being planted?

A bakery is making cookies and cakes for a large order. They need to make at least $50$ items in total. Cookies require $10$ minutes of preparation time each, and cakes require $25$ minutes of preparation time each. The bakery has a maximum of $15$ hours ($900$ minutes) of preparation time available. They must make at least $20$ cookies and at least $10$ cakes. Which of the following systems of inequalities represents these conditions, if $x$ is the number of cookies and $y$ is the number of cakes?
